Summary: Clotilda Clo Kemei added a Note for Beatriz Gobalesa @ 20/12/2025 10:00 am - 04:30 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** 20/12/25 10am- 4:30pm **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** 10am - arrived at placement. B was having her breakfast . She took her morning medication while supervised. She refused to take osmolax and opted to take it in the evening. B was getting ready to go to mums. Staff assisted B in cleaning the house. We emptied the dishes washer, cleaned, and disposed of all the expired food from the fridge. We cleaned both toilets. B vaccumed the house while I assisted in mopping the floors. B folded clothes while i water the plants. B was impatient and anxious and wanted to leave for mum without completing all the tasks. She would get upset when asked to assist in doing some chores. B also asked staff not to dispose of some items from the fridge even though they were expired. Her decision was respected. 12pm - Staff took B to the chemist warehouse in Macgregor. She purchased a perfume of her choice and then went back home. Upon arrival, back to the unit, all bins were emptied. B assisted in taking her belongings to the car. 12:30 pm - B left home for mums. She appeared tired and dozzed off on the way. 1:15pm - B arrived home. Staff assisted her in taking all her belongings into her room. We arranged her clothes in the wardrobe. B's mum had prepared lunch for her. B was excited to be back home. **Incidents and Action** **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity** 35km covered community access Staff couldn't clock out as the shift ended at B's mum address.

Detailed report: **General Status:** 6am Danny was in bed asleep 7am Danny was in bed asleep 8am Danny groceries arrived I put them away and started meal preparation. Summary: Sheick Kamara added a Note for Luke Taylor @ 21/12/2025 11:00 pm - 09:00 am
Detailed report: Client: Luke Shift: Overnight Shift Start: 11:00 pm Shift End: 9:00 am Progress Note Behaviour & Sleep: At the commencement of shift (11:00 pm), Luke was awake in his room, humming and intermittently pacing in and out of his room. He appeared unsettled but non-aggressive. Luke settled and went to bed at approximately 12:30 am. At 3:00 am, Luke woke to use the toilet and voided his bladder. Following this, he paced around the house for a short period before returning to bed. Staff continued quiet monitoring to ensure Luke’s safety while pacing and resting. At 5:00 am, Luke woke again, turned on all the lights, requested snacks, and began pacing while making high-pitched noises. Staff provided reassurance and verbal prompts, successfully encouraging Luke to return to bed. At 6:00 am, Luke independently turned off all lights and went back to bed, where he slept until morning. Luke woke at 7:30 am. Toileting & Personal Care: 3:00 am: Passed urine independently 7:30 am: Personal care completed; Luke had a large bowel motion Morning Routine: At 8:00 am, Luke had breakfast and took his prescribed medications as per his medication chart. Handover: At 9:00 am, Luke was handed over to the CAS team for scheduled community access activities. Incidents: No incidents reported during the shift. Staff Actions: Staff maintained quiet supervision throughout the night, provided prompts as required, and ensured Luke’s safety and wellbeing at all times.

Summary: Hayley Mons Mackellar added a Note for Ross Daly @ 22/12/2025 08:30 am - 02:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** Arrived at the hospital at 8:30am and waited for Ross to complete his morning shower. A pad change was completed and a hospital gown was applied. Ross had breakfast (pancakes, yoghurt and tea). Ross was then transferred to the taxi waiting bay and picked up by taxi at approximately 10:45am. Upon arrival at the unit, Ross was shown around and appeared happy and talkative. Sherin assisted me to transfer Ross into his bed using the hoist. Neil arrived with Ross’s medications and gift basket, the TV was turned on for Ross and he was repositioned comfortably in bed. Ross’s belongings were unpacked and put away with assistance. Lunch was offered, however Ross stated he was not very hungry at that time. Ross’s washing was put on. Ross’s brother arrived shortly after with additional belongings, then later went out to complete a food shop for Ross. A pad change was completed (bowels opened ST7), Ross was changed into clean clothes and his hair was combed. Bins were taken out on departure. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Behaviour •Ross appeared happy, calm and talkative throughout the shift •Engaged well and was completely cooperative with all transfers and person cares Personal Care •Pad change completed at hospital •Hospital gown applied •Assisted transfer into bed using hoist •Repositioned comfortably in bed •Pad change completed due to bowels opening •Changed into clean clothes •Hair combed Medications •Medications delivered by Neil, morning medications taken at the hospital Skin Check - small bruises on stomach noticed during pad change Food Intake •Breakfast consumed at hospital (pancakes, yoghurt, tea) •Lunch offered but declined as Ross stated he was not hungry •Brother completed a food shop for Ross Activities •Transported from hospital to unit via taxi •Oriented to the unit environment •TV turned on for comfort •Belongings unpacked and put away •Washing completed •Bins taken out on departure **Incidents and Action** **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** •Ross will require wipes, as he currently does not have any and had to borrow wipes from Mark •Ross does not have catheter equipment available and will need supplies organised - Ross also will need bedsheets/pillow cases as he doesn’t have any **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity** Was unable to clock in due to starting at the hospital

Summary: Anna Eldhose added a Note for Duy Nguyen @ 23/12/2025 02:00 pm - 10:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** Date: 23/12/25 Time: 2:00 PM – 10:00 PM Anna & Honourine General Status Handover received from morning staff at the commencement of the shift. On arrival, Duy was playing with Piggy. Throughout the shift, Duy’s behaviour was unstable and restless, with multiple neuro episodes and self-harm behaviours observed. He made repeated attempts to jump off the toilet and wheelchair and required frequent redirection and reassurance from staff. By the end of the shift, Duy was calmer, settled, and attempting to fall asleep. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Behaviour: Duy’s behaviour was unstable for most of the shift. Attempted to remove his undies and trousers, at times remaining naked. Multiple attempts to jump off the toilet and wheelchair. Compulsive standing in the bathroom and sitting on the floor. Pushed away support workers and was often unwilling to follow instructions. During mealtimes, Duy attempted to lick his finger/palm and spit out food; staff provided redirection and reassurance as required. Total episodes documented: 8 self-harm incidents and 24 neuro episodes during the shift. Behavioural timeline: 14:24 – Toilet, bowel motion T4 large 15:00 – Afternoon tea 15:00 – Hand mouthing ×1, RP: hold and stabilise 15:10 – Head banging ×1, RP: pillow 15:27 – Hand biting ×2, NRP: verbally redirected 16:04 – Toilet, bladder motion large 16:05 – Neuro ×5 16:43 – Neuro ×5 17:36 – Toilet, bladder motion large 17:46 – Neuro ×4; attempted to jump off wheelchair in toilet 18:08 – Dinner, dinner medications and eye drops administered 18:10 – Neuro ×5 19:18 – Hand mouthing ×1, RP: hold and stabilise 19:28 – Toilet, bladder motion large; compulsive standing observed 19.36 – Toilet Bowel motion large Personal Care Assisted with toileting as required throughout the shift. Hygiene maintained. Continence care provided, and pads/undergarments replaced as needed. Medications All medications administered as prescribed: 18:08 – Dinner medications and eye drops 20:00 – Bedtime medications Skin Checks Skin intact with nil concerns noted. Food Intake Afternoon tea provided at 15:00 Dinner provided at 18:00 Staff supported and redirected Duy during meals as required. Activities Encouraged Duy to say “thank you” after afternoon tea and dinner; he complied. After dinner, Duy placed his dishes in the sink. Encouraged to sit in his wheelchair after dinner. Podcast played and changed to relaxing music at 8:00 PM to promote settling. Daily Tasks All daily tasks were completed: Shower chair returned from the balcony Washed clothes folded and placed in the cupboard Kitchen cleaned, including bench and sink Washed dishes organised and placed in cupboards **Incidents and Action** Incidents and Actions 15:00 – Hand mouthing ×1, RP: hold and stabilise 15:10 – Head banging ×1, RP: pillow 15:27 – Hand biting ×2, NRP: verbally 19:18 – Hand mouthing ×1, RP: hold and stabilise 19:34 – Hand biting ×2, NRP: verbally redirected 21:00 – Hand mouthing ×1, RP: blocked 21:16 – Hand mouthing ×2, RP: hold and stabilise **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity** Nil

Summary: Phoebe Lola Simmons added a Note for Ralph Carmona @ 23/12/2025 07:00 am - 03:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** Date: 23/12/2025 Time: 7:00AM - 3:00PM Participant: Ralph Carmona Staff: Phoebe Simmons Ralph enjoyed his physiotherapy session at Spinal Life. He was able to spend time socialising and accomplished his personal exercise routine as well. He met a nice old lady at lunch we chatted with for a while and then Ralph enjoyed a relaxing rest of his afternoon. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Behaviour: Ralph was consistently positive and engaging throughout the shift. He was his usual self. Personal Care: Nil. Medications: Nil. Skin Checks: No skin issues noted. Food Intake: 10:00am Coffee at Spinal Life. 12:00pm KFC chicken and chips. A can of soft drink. 2:00pm An ice cream at home. Activities: 7:00am Started with Ralph. He welcomed me in happily. We chatted until he was ready to leave then he drove us to Spinal Life in his vehicle. 8:00am Ralph’s physiotherapy session began. He started off practicing a variety of movements at the bars to work on his coordination with his right leg. Then Ralph received assistance with stretching his legs. He performed a few sets of glute bridges and hamstring curls with an ankle weight on the right leg. 9:00am Ralph’s session concluded. He spent time chatting with a friend for a while. Then Ralph checked at reception to see about any available session times for tomorrow. He decided to leave today as the last session until Monday 5th of January when his normal session times are ongoing again. 10:00am Ralph decided to have a coffee and rest in the tea room where he could continue enjoying socialising. At half past 10, Ralph began his personal exercise routine on the upper body machines with his right hand assistive device. 11:30am Ralph finished up at the gym and was ready to head off. On the way back to his place he stopped to fill up his car with cheap fuel as he noticed a cheaper price displayed. Then he stopped at KFC for lunch and we spent an hour chatting to a nice old lady there. 1:30pm We arrived back at Ralph’s place, he turned his aircon on and sat down on the couch with his water bottle. We chatted and watched suspenseful movies for the afternoon. 3:00pm CLOCK OUT. Ralph satisfied with the day’s activities. Shift concluded. **Incidents and Action** **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity**

Judy A family friend of Beven’s and Jenny. Jenny and Judy and arrived around 3:35pm Whilst me and Tom who stayed back till 4:00pm to look after Beven until she gets back. 4:20pm Jenny left to drop Judy back to her home And it was just me and Beven and Jenny’s mother. I started to prepare Beven’s Dinner for Him Fed him and given him his medication and cleaning hands and wipe face and rinsing of his mouth. Dinner started around 5:00pm and there is no eating past 6:00pm. After dinner 6:00pm News on Channel 9 was on for Beven. 6:35pm Did his Oral care, brushing of his teeth and cough and suction assist before bedtime. Beven seemed very tired today so he was keen to get some rest. He’s was back in bed by 7:45pm sleeping. Few bell rings for a reposition, or to help scratch his back As he can’t get his hands to reach his back fully because of his medical condition. So would assist him. Beven and Jenny give me a Christmas spirit card with my name on it. Summary: Rhiannon Camiller added a Note for Danny Barsby @ 23/12/2025 06:00 am - 04:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** 6am Danny in bed asleep 7am Danny in bed asleep 8am Danny in bed asleep 9am Danny in bed asleep 10am Danny woke up I assisted him to the toilet where he urinated I then assisted him to the lounge where he had his morning medication and breakfast he had a yogurt with blueberries. Danny’s mother arrived and dropped off some Christmas treats for Danny. He had a chat with his mum then I assisted him back to bed as he was still tired. 11am Danny’s mum left and cleaned the kitchen. 12pm Danny woke up he came out to the lounge I made him some scrambled eggs and a salami and cheese croissant for lunch as his teeth were super sore. I gave him his lunch medication and panadol for his tooth. 1pm Danny went back to bed I assisted him and made sure he was comfortable he then went to sleep. 2pm Danny was in bed asleep. I cleaned the apartment 3pm Danny woke up he went to the toilet where he opened his bowels a large 5. I then shaved Danny’s face. I then asked Danny if he was ready for a shower he said yes I assisted him with undressing while he was in the shower I prompted him with how to wash his body and where to wash his body. After the shower I assisted Danny with drying his body, putting on moisturizer, deodorant and aftershave I then assisted him with getting into fresh clothes and fresh contents aid. I brushed Danny’s teeth. after I assisted Danny into bed as he was still tired. 4pm Danny was in bed asleep **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Medication for breakfast and lunch administered Panadol given for tooth pain Breakfast and lunch eaten Showered Refused community access **Incidents and Action** **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity**

Summary: Honorine Uwineza added a Note for Duy Nguyen @ 24/12/2025 02:00 pm - 10:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** Date-24/12/2025. Time-2:00 PM - 10:00 PM. Client -Duy Nguyen Staff -Abhilash & Honorine At the start of the shift, Duy was playing with Piggy on his bed and received handover from the morning shift staff. Duy was tired and drowsy today,he spent most of the time playing with Piggy. His behavior was unstable with two self-harm incident and four neuro episodes during the shift.By the end of the shift, he was trying to fall asleep. Duy went to the toilet seven times for bladder motion and twice for bowel movement during the shift. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Behaviour: • Duy was tired and drowsy today,his behavior was unstable • Duy exhibited behavior by removing his trousers and being naked. He did this multiple times during the shift. The SW redirected him to put his clothes back on, but he was unwilling to follow the SW's instructions. • Duy was restless during every bathroom visit, always trying to stand up and put his legs on the toilet, pushing SW away. He was not willing to follow SW's instructions. • During mealtime,Duy exhibited behaviors such as licking his palm, spitting out the food, and all verbal prompts were unsuccessful. • observed a new behavior,Duy was biting his piggy coins forcefully. He did this a few times, and suddenly SW intervened, took the coins, and ensured safety. • 02.18 pm-Neuro episodes ×2 each lasted 10 seconds duration • 02.35 pm-Neuro episodes ×2 each lasted 30 seconds duration • 04.22 pm-Compulsive standing (from the toilet) • 05.32 pm-Neuro episodes ×7 each lasted 10 seconds duration • 06.05 pm-Neuro episodes ×5 each lasted 1 minutes duration • 06.57 pm-Compulsive standing (from the toilet) • 07.21 pm-Hand mouthing -RP hold and stabilized • 07.52 pm-Hand mouthing -RP hold and stabilized • 08.00 pm-Compulsive standing (from the toilet) • 08.59 pm-Compulsive standing (from the toilet) Personal care: Hygiene was maintained, and the staff made sure Duy was clean. 08.00 pm-Assisted with brushing teeth. wiped his body, applied moisturizer, and changed his clothes . • Toileting Blader motion - 02.35 pm-Bladder motion large 03.28 pm-Bladder motion large 04.22 pm-Bladder motion large 04.45 pm-Bladder motion large 05.30 pm-Bladder motion large 06.34 pm-Bladder motion large 06.57 pm-Nill output 08.00 pm-Bladder motion large 09.38 pm-Nill output Bowel movement - 02.18 pm-Bowel movement T4 large 08.59 pm-Bowel movement T4 large Medications: All the medications where administered as prescribed 06.00 pm-Dinner time medication and Eye drops 08.00 pm-Bedtime medication Skin Checks : Nill concerns. Staff 1 and Staff 2 concluded the shift at 11:00 PM. **Incidents and Actions Taken** No incidents occurred during the shift. **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** A final welfare check was completed at 11:00 PM prior to Staff 1 and Staff 2 ending the shift. **Irregularities** No irregularities were noted.

Detailed report: **General Status:** **General Overview** Luke was handed over at 4:00 PM and greeted staff pleasantly. Staff were informed that he had a positive day at CAS. Upon entering the house, Luke turned off all lights and closed the doors before using the toilet. He then obtained his remote from staff and settled to watch television. Luke’s mother visited at approximately 5:40 PM to return his clothes following laundry, and Luke appeared happy to see her. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** **Assessments and Activities** **Behaviour** Luke vocalised consistently throughout the afternoon, with increased vocalisations observed during the evening. These included whistling and a variety of sounds, primarily while pacing in front of the television. **Physical Activity & Engagement** Luke participated in light physical activity with staff, completing simple arm movements such as raising and lowering his hands. He appeared engaged and cheerful during the activity and afterwards ran up and down the house while whistling. **Personal Care & Hygiene** At approximately 6:45 PM, Luke was supported to have a shower after dinner. Staff 1 provided direct assistance while Staff 2 cleaned the bathroom. Skin integrity remained intact, and no concerns were noted. **Meals & Medication** Luke chose to have burger rings for dinner and ate them as requested. At approximately 7:50 PM, he was given his evening medication while seated in the lounge watching television. **Bedtime Routine & Shift Conclusion** Luke commenced his bedtime routine at around 8:15 PM, which included his usual singing and whistling. He declined earlier prompts to go to bed but eventually settled and was quiet in bed by 11:00 PM. Staff 1 and Staff 2 concluded the shift at 11:00 PM. **Incidents and Action** No incidents occurred during the shift. **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** A final welfare check was completed at 11:00 PM prior to Staff 1 and Staff 2 ending the shift. **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity** No irregularities were noted.

Detailed report: **General Status:** Participant: Luke Taylor Staff: Benedict Date: 23/12/2025 Shift Time: 2300hrs – 0900hrs Arrival and Handover • At 2300hrs, handover was received from outgoing staff. • During handover, Luke was awake and unclothed, engaging in hand gazing, humming, pacing, and scrolling through YouTube videos. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Behaviour, Incidents & Actions • Luke appeared unsettled initially. He later requested Burger Rings. • Fluid intake was encouraged and remained adequate throughout the shift. Activities • Luke engaged in watching TV, pacing, and producing high-pitched vocalisations throughout the shift. • 0650hrs: Luke had a bowel movement; staff provided hygiene support and cleaned him. • 0700hrs: Luke remained in the bathtub for approximately 20 minutes during his shower. **Incidents and Action** Luke appeared unsettled initially. Summary: Oladimeji Tedimola (Dj) added a Note for Luke Taylor @ 23/12/2025 04:00 pm - 11:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Overview** Luke was handed over at 4:00 PM and greeted staff in a friendly manner. Staff were informed that Luke had experienced a positive day at CAS. Upon entering the house, Luke independently switched off lights and closed doors before using the toilet. He then requested his remote from staff and settled in the lounge to watch television. Luke appeared settled and content throughout the early part of the afternoon. **Assessments and Activities** **Behaviour** Luke engaged in frequent vocalisations during the shift, with an increase noted later in the evening. These included whistling and a range of repetitive sounds, most commonly observed while he paced back and forth in front of the television. **Physical Activity & Engagement** Luke participated in light physical activity with staff, completing simple arm exercises such as lifting and lowering his hands. He appeared cheerful and enthusiastic during the activity. Following this, Luke moved energetically around the house, running back and forth while continuing to whistle. **Personal Care & Hygiene** At 6:45 PM, Luke was supported to shower after dinner. Staff 1 provided direct assistance while Staff 2 cleaned the bathroom area. Luke’s skin integrity was checked and found to be intact, with no concerns identified. **Meals & Medication** Luke requested and was provided burger rings for dinner. At 7:50 PM, Luke was administered his evening medication while seated comfortably in the lounge watching television. **Bedtime Routine & Shift Conclusion** Luke began his bedtime routine at approximately 8:20 PM, engaging in his usual singing and whistling. He initially declined prompts to go to bed. At 10:00 PM, Luke was observed to come out of his room and sit in the lounge area. Staff suspected the room temperature may have been too warm due to the weather and adjusted the air conditioning to a cooler setting. Luke was then prompted and supported to return to bed. He eventually settled and became quiet by 11:00 PM. Staff 1 and Staff 2 concluded the shift at 11:00 PM. **Incidents and Actions Taken** No incidents occurred during the shift. **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** A final welfare check was completed at 11:00 PM prior to Staff 1 and Staff 2 ending the shift. **Irregularities** No irregularities were noted.

Summary: Abdullateef Kuranga added a Note for Mohammed Sunny Manikam @ 24/12/2025 02:00 pm - 10:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** Client Name: Mohamed (Sunny) Manikan. Date: Wednesday, 24/12/25 Time: 14:00 - 22:00 Staff: Abdul & Natalia General status: Upon arrival, handover received from morning staff. At the start of the shift, Sunny was awake, lying on RS position. Probiotic medication not yet given by the AM shift staff. Sunny was generally good during the shift, he had nil eye gaze engagement because,Sunny did not actively opened his eyes. He, however, listened to Quran and watched movies on his IPad. Sunny had NBO, and Nil incident. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Assessment / activities - Vitals checked and documented - Physio exercise done. - E stim + Hand splints application done. Tracheostomy Management 2nos. Trachy suction done: - 15:20 - Nil Output - 19:20 - small, white, thin - Inner cannula changed x2; oral suction attended whenever needed. - Cuff’s pressure checked & adjusted x2 (From 10 & 20 to 28 @ 15:05 & 19:30 respectively) - In-line suction done x2 (output: nil & 1.2mls, creamy, thick @ 15:05 & 19:30 respectively) - Split dressing changed x1 @21:00 SPC Management - Urine emptied total - 2,010 - Total fluid intake - 1,970 Medication Administration Medication administered as per webster pack, recommended flush given. Evening meds (nexium & regular) @19:40. Osmolax given @21:30 with 250mls water.Nebuliser administered x2 - @16:20 & @19:40. Personal Cares & Skin Checks - NBO. - Skin check - Intact, Moisturiser applied. Nil concerns Fluid & Food Intake - Peg feed adminisred @16:25 and 20:20 (215 mls each) - Extra Water given @18:10 (250mls) Eye-gaze Engagement The device was not in use by Sunny because he did not actively opened his eyes. He, however, listened to Quran and watched movies on the device. Other Cares - Oral care done, by mum @15:30 - AIRVO applied @21:10 - All assigned house tasks completed, canisters cleaned - Handed over to the night shift staff @22:00 **Incidents and Action** Nil **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** Staff to continue monitoring Sunny’s vital signs, saliva secretions, chesty coughs and any signs of pain. Summary: Phoebe Lola Simmons added a Note for Ralph Carmona @ 24/12/2025 07:00 am - 03:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** Date: 24/12/2025 Time: 7:00AM - 3:00PM Participant: Ralph Carmona Staff: Phoebe Simmons Ralph was in a great mood throughout the day. He was able to collect his parcel with a new cooling doona for his bed. He enjoyed some community access and was very conversational throughout the day. He looks forward to spending Christmas Day with his mother tomorrow. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Behaviour: Ralph was consistently positive and engaging throughout the shift. He was his usual self. Personal Care: Nil. Medications: Nil. Skin Checks: No skin issues noted. Food Intake: 600ml water bottle. 11:00am Pepperoni Pizza and Spinach and Feta Gozleme with a can of Solo from the Kebab Palace. 2:00pm Magnum ice cream at home. Activities: 7:00am Started with Ralph. He welcomed me in happily. We watched music videos and chatted until he was ready to go out. 7:30am Ralph drove us to Garden City. We played a game of table tennis upon arrival and then went to pick up his parcel at the parcel lockers. I assisted Ralph to carry his parcel. 8:30am Ralph stops at the bank to get some cash out to give his Mum tomorrow for Christmas. Then we looked in Pop mart before heading back to his car. Ralph then drove us to check out the Fish Factory. When we got there, there was a massive line of people to buy seafood for Christmas. Ralph was amazed. 10:30am Ralph decided to have lunch at the Kebab Palace near his place since the Fish Factory was so busy. He ordered some food and really enjoyed what he chose for lunch. We chatted there for a while. 11:30am Ralph was ready to head back to his place. When we arrived back at his place, we opened his package with his new cooling doona in it. We put Ralph’s current bedding on a wash cycle and then in the dryer. We watched movies and chatted while we waited. 1:30 I assisted Ralph in putting on his fresh bedding and new cooling doona. He likes how it feels and looks forward to sleeping with it. We finished off the movie for the afternoon. 3:00pm CLOCK OUT. Ralph satisfied with the day’s activities. Shift concluded. **Incidents and Action** **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity**

Summary: Soumyamol Sabumon added a Note for Carmel Young @ 25/12/2025 08:00 am - 04:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** Carmel seemed happy and calm upon arrival, as she was able to open her door independently with her Access. She spoke with me about the past few days, explaining the process of moving into this new accommodation, as well as details on her relocation. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Carmel seemed happy and calm upon arrival, as she was able to open her door independently with her Access. She spoke with me about the past few days, explaining the process of moving into this new accommodation, as well as details on her relocation. When i arrived, Carmel was finishing her breakfast. Once she had finished that meal, she decided to take some time to rest in her bed. That rest period lasted approximately 30 minutes before she was ready to get up again. During the remainder of the day, Carmel spent most of the time resting yet remained interactive and engaged with me telling stories and memories. The apartment and surrounding property were all cleaned and sorted out while this was happening. The cleaning included washing the dishes, washing and drying clothes, mopping, and removing all rubbish. Medications - 2 tabs of Emexlon were administered and given as a PRN prescription and 2 tabs of Phenergan 10 mg were administered due to nausea at 10 am - The 12:00 pm and 2:00 pm dosing of medication was provided - The 6:00 pm, 6:00 am, and 8:00 am medications were placed in separate, enclosed containers, kept next to the bed, along with any other needed PRN medications. Bowel and Bladder Patterns - Carmel had two bowel movements and both of these movements were of large size. - There were no issues concerning her bladder. Food and Fluid Intake - The breakfast was completed independently upon the arrival of Carmel. - Lunch was served at 12:30 pm and consisted of rice with vegetables, chicken and mushrooms, along with a cola to drink. At 1 PM, Carmel consumed 2 pieces of Kitkat and 1 Mars from the vending machine. Carmel had sufficient fluid intake throughout the day, with water and coconut drinks. At 2.45 pm Carmel Walk along with me to the pool at level and to the ground floor. Shift end at 4 pm Additional Notes I am unable to clock in and out through the ShiftCare app due to the unavailability of Wi-Fi/internet. Shift started at 7.55 am and ends at 4 pm **Incidents and Action** **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity**

Summary: Joshua Zulu added a Note for Luke Taylor @ 24/12/2025 11:00 pm - 09:00 am
Detailed report: **General Status:** Staff commenced shift at 11:00 PM and received handover from PM staff. On arrival, Luke was awake and pacing in his room. Active supervision was maintained to support safety. At 11:45 PM, staff assisted Luke with personal care, which he accepted well. Luke remained awake afterward, engaging positively with staff through play and conversation. He settled and went to sleep at approximately 12:40 AM. At 3:30 AM, Luke woke and independently used the toilet. He then requested the TV remote and watched video clips for a period at a loud volume. Staff monitored and supported him to manage noise levels. Luke remained in a positive mood throughout. At 7:00 AM, staff supported Luke with breakfast, which he completed without concern. Following breakfast, Luke became heightened in his room and began yelling. He used an existing wrist injury to smear blood on the wall. Staff provided immediate redirection, successfully calming Luke and stopping the behaviour. Staff then assisted with personal hygiene and cleaned and dressed the wound appropriately. At 7:45 AM, Luke’s Behaviour Practitioner arrived and observed while staff supported Luke to get dressed. Staff completed household cleaning and assisted Luke in preparing for community access. At 9:00 AM, staff completed handover to CAS staff, ensuring all relevant information, including the morning incident, was clearly communicated. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** **Incidents and Action** **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity**

Detailed report: **General Status:** Good **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** At approximately 6:00pm, OSS staff contacted Carmel to check on her wellbeing and attend as scheduled to assist with medication administration. Summary: Harold Bundoo added a Note for Beven Jarmey @ 26/12/2025 06:00 am - 02:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** 6-2 Came into work and met Beven in his room sleeping with no audio book on. Took over from Patrick. Went in to say hello and check on him as well. 6:20am Beven rang the bell for a bottle pee and I assisted him with it and disposed of it in the bathroom. Beven had nappies on when I came in this morning. Changed his clothing to fresh and clean ones before coming for breakfast. 7:00 Beven is resting in bed with his Audio book playing. 7:28am Rang the bell for a repositioning and a itch on his back and I assisted him and got it done. 8:00 Beven was out of bed and at his dinning table ready for breakfast to be served. Before Breakfast: Cough assist and suction machine is performed by Beven and I assisted him with it and recorded it down in Beven’s log book. After that: One Zoton is given yo Beven and he was were before taking it. A warm Milo drink to help smooth and relax his throat muscles before eating. A heat pack warmed up for his neck muscles to relax as well. Bubbles blown by Beven to open up and throat muscles before eating. Breakfast started: 8:35am Kit Kat cereal today and mixed with one fortisip and 4 teaspoon of sugars Second breakfast: 3 Bacon and 2 eggs blended smoothly and safely for Beven’s consumption. After Breakfast: Medication was given and Beven was aware of this. One Panamax mixed with custard And 0.5 of Vitamin D in his mouth. After breakfast. Cleaning of hands and facials and rinsing of mouth after each meal. 10:00am Beven was back to bed resting and his audio book was playing. 11:00am Beven is back bed resting sleeping with his audio book on. He didn’t get much sleep when he went back to bed. Few coughing episodes here and there, but nothing major, assisted him to recover by adjusting him to sit up straight and tilt forward to avoid choking, 30-40 seconds of this and getting him to breath in and out and staying calm, always does the trick. After his recovery a nice drinking water clears the throat airways and it’s easier to swallow and cough. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** NA **Incidents and Action** NA **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** NA **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity** NA

Slept for about 1 hour. 0930-1130: Danny wandering on and off, slightly confused and unsure what he should. Redirection provided. Gave Danny some snack (chips, cake and cordial). Danny complaining that his head is hurting gave him some Panadol with good effect. 1155: took Danny out for a short walk out the front of building, which he appeared to enjoy. Returned back to unit and Danny watched some tv. 1230: Danny asleep in bed. Woken up to take his lunch time medications and went back to sleep. 1330: Unit maintained, Danny’s bathroom cleaned, floors mopped. Load of washing put on and another load in the dryer. Danny remains asleep. 1500: Danny remains asleep visual checks completed. 1600: completion of shift. Summary: Oladimeji Tedimola (Dj) added a Note for Luke Taylor @ 26/12/2025 04:00 pm - 11:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** General Overview Luke was handed over to staff at 4:00 PM. Staff were advised that Luke had a positive day at CAS. Upon arrival luke handed his bag to staff at the office, Luke followed his usual routine by closing doors and arranging the areas the way he wants it before independently using the toilet. He then collected the TV remote from staff and settled in the loungeroom to watch television. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Assessments and Activities Behaviour Luke vocalised throughout the shift, with an increase noted during the evening. Vocalisations included whistling and other repetitive sounds, primarily while pacing in front of the television. Behaviour remained non-aggressive and consistent with Luke’s baseline presentation. Luke was prompted for his evening walk but he declined, staff respected his choice and offered re assurance. Physical Activity & Engagement Luke engaged in light physical activity with staff, including kicking a ball indoors. He responded positively to staff encouragement and remained engaged for short periods. Personal Care & Hygiene At 6:45 PM, Luke was supported to shower following dinner. Staff 1 provided direct assistance with prompting and supervision, while Staff 2 cleaned and reset the bathroom. Skin integrity was checked, and no concerns were identified. Staff applied antiseptic creams to his wound affected areas. Meals & Medication • Dinner: Luke had pasta with minced beef sauce. He also requested and consumed Burger Rings snacks with pepsi max • Medication: Luke’s evening medication was administered at 8:00 PM while he was seated in the loungeroom watching TV. Medication was taken as prescribed Bedtime Routine & Shift Conclusion Luke began his bedtime routine at approximately 10:00 PM, which included pacing, vocalising, singing, and whistling. He remained awake pacing in the loungeroom area without any agressive or heightened behaviour. Luke was handed over to next staff. Both Staffs completed routine checks and concluded the shift at 11:00 PM. **Incidents and Action** **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity**

Summary: Mohammed Lakhal added a Note for Paul Bowman @ 26/12/2025 06:00 am - 02:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** Paul was sleeping in his room on my arrival **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Paul was still sleeping in his room on my arrival. The changeover was completed with the previous staff with no issues. At 7:25 am I assisted Paul with grooming, showering, drying his skin and putting on his clothes. After that Paul had his some cereals and milk for his breakfast followed by his medications and then went back to his room and started watching the News. After that I cleaned the bathroom including the toilet and the sink and then I washed Paul’s clothes, dried them and later on, put them away, I also swept out the front door and removed all the tree leaves. At 9:00 am I drove Paul and Garth to Mt Gravatt Plaza, then to his Dad's old house, then to Mt Gravatt Mountain, then we drove to the subway shop and then we drove back home. After that Paul had some biscuits for his morning tea and then he kept chilling in his room till 11:00 am when he had his first Subway sandwich and then went back to his room and started watching his favourite program till 12:15 pm when he had his second Subway sandwich. At 13:00 pm I drove Paul and Garth to Mt Gravatt Mountain, then we drove to his old house and then we drove back home. Paul and I had a conversation about his daughter Anna saying that it was a very emotional moment for both of them when they met last Tuesday after a few years and he was happy to see his grandson and his Dad for the first time, he also told me that he was happy to see his son and his wife. Pau also told me that he will call his son this afternoon to ask him about his daughter's new contact number because he missed her a lot and he loves to talk to her. It was a good shift with no issues. **Incidents and Action** **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity**

Summary: Nanise Mafi added a Note for Carmel Young @ 27/12/2025 04:00 pm - 10:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** 05:50pm - Duration: 20mins - Support: Assistance with Medication I arrived at 5:50pm and knocked on her door. Carmel called out for me to let myself in. I obliged. Carmel was just coming out of her bedroom when I entered her unit. Exchange pleasantries. Carmel took me to her bathroom and pointed to the duress on the wall. She stated that she tried to use it last night as she needed PRN but she didn’t hear anything back from concierge. I pressed the button a few times and told her that I will check once I get back to the office. I asked her about the small duress button which I found sitting on her dining table. I advised her to keep on her and use that duress key. She was happy to have the duress that she can keep on her rather than walking to the bathroom. I put my gloves on. Carmel showed me to her bedroom and showed me where the safe is. I punched in the code then got her medication out. I put 6pm medication in the container. Carmel asked for PRN. I checked for PRN medication but not much info ie doses. I assisted with Webster pack and PRN. Carmel asked for me to put 8pm and 6am in a container for her. I advise her about her medication plan and I reassured her that I will be back at 7:50pm to assist with 8pm medication. Carmel was happy with that. Summary: Soumyamol Sabumon added a Note for Carmel Young @ 26/12/2025 08:00 am - 04:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Carmel seemed happy and calm upon arrival, as she was able to open her door independently with her Access.she met and greet and chat with her neighbour. When i arrived, Carmel was finishing her breakfast. Once she had finished that meal, she decided to take some time to rest in her bed. That rest period lasted approximately 45 minutes before she was ready to get up again. During the remainder of the day, Carmel spent most of the time with her. She went to her mother’s place at 1 pm .I dropped her at Holland Park southern cross care duhig village, she said she would like stay with them , and will be back after 5 pm by a cab. The apartment and surrounding property were all cleaned and sorted out while this was happening. The cleaning included washing the dishes, washing and drying clothes, mopping, and removing all rubbish. A shopping done , Aldi, Cole’s, Woolworths at 9 am back at 12.20 pm Medications - 2 tabs of Emexlon were administered and given as a PRN prescription and 2 tabs of Phenergan 10 mg were administered due to nausea at 9 am - The 12:00 pm and 2:00 pm dosing of medication was provided - The 6:00 pm, 6:00 am, and 8:00 am medications were placed in separate, enclosed containers, kept next to the bed, along with any other needed PRN medications. Bowel and Bladder Patterns - Carmel had two bowel movements and both of these movements were of large size. - There were no issues concerning her bladder. Food and Fluid Intake - The breakfast was completed independently upon the arrival of Carmel. - Lunch was served at 10 am ( self)and consisted of rice with vegetables, chicken and mushrooms, along with a cola to drink. Clock in at 8 am, click out at 4 pm Clock in and out couldn’t perform as Carmel Flat still don’t have internet access . **Incidents and Action** **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity**

Summary: Charen Eduaba added a Note for Carmel Young @ 27/12/2025 08:00 am - 04:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** Carmel Young 27/12/2025 8am-4pm **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** When I arrived, Carmel met me on the ground floor as I was unable to access the stairs. She gave me a brief tour of her flat. Carmel then had a shower, and I dried the bathroom floor afterwards. At 9:45 am, we went for a 500 m walk. After the walk, we sat and waited for her order from the chemist to arrive. Once it arrived, we went for another walk of approximately 600 m to the barbershop for Carmel to have her hair cut. We arrived at the barbershop at 10:55 am and waited for our turn. Carmel took her medication at 11:30 am. We returned to the unit at 12:30 pm, and Carmel had a short nap as she was tired from the walking. I washed and hang out her clothes. I then prepared pizza for her lunch as requested. Carmel took her medication again at 2:00 pm and went back to sleep. At 3:00 pm, she woke up and had her lunch (pizza and Coke), then returned to sleep at 3:30 pm. At 3:40 pm, I went downstairs to buy Snickers and chips for Carmel as requested. Folded clothes done. I finished my shift and clocked out at 4:00 pm. **Incidents and Action** **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity**

Summary: Passang Dema added a Note for Dale Johnstone @ 27/12/2025 06:00 am - 02:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** Dale remained stable throughout the shift. His abdominal discomfort resolved after a bowel movement and coffee. Despite a frequent cough and sore arms, he was comfortable, relaxed, and cooperative. He was alert, engaged in conversation, and tolerated food, fluids, and medications well. Overall, Dale was settled with no further concerns noted. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Behaviour: Dale woke up experiencing abdominal pain. He felt better after having a bowel movement and his morning coffee. He spent his time watching cricket on TV and chatting with staff. He also complained of sore arms, which were supported by staff through the application of magnesium cream. Dale had a frequent cough; however, overall he remained relaxed and composed. He took all medications on time without issues. Personal Care: • 08:00: Dale woke up and was transferred to the shower commode. He had a bowel movement. Dale declined to have a shower due to abdominal pain. • A fresh pad was applied. • All bed linen was changed. • Urine bottle was disinfected. • 10:50: Dale complained of sore arms; magnesium cream was applied. Food Intake: • Dale had a cup of warm water after being transferred to his wheelchair. • 08:30: One cup of cappuccino and a lamington. • 11:00: One Up & Go drink. • 12:30: One cup of cappuccino. Medication: • 08:30: Pre-breakfast and lunch medications administered. • 11:00: Post-breakfast medication administered. Summary: Joshua Zulu added a Note for Luke Taylor @ 27/12/2025 03:00 pm - 11:00 pm
Detailed report: **General Status:** Participant: Luke Date: 27/12/2025 Shift Time: 3:00 PM – 11:00 PM Staff on Duty: Benedict, Joshua Shift Handover 3:00 PM: Shift handover completed. Luke presented with a positive affect, greeted staff appropriately, engaged in brief social interaction, and gave a thumbs-up gesture. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Behaviour Luke remained generally calm, settled, and comfortable throughout the shift. He engaged positively with staff and activities. Luke displayed self-stimulatory behaviour on two occasions while watching inappropriate YouTube content. Staff maintained dignity and safety, provided appropriate support, and completed cleaning and disinfection of the area in line with hygiene protocols. Community Access & Activities 4:00 PM: Luke attended community access for weekly grocery shopping at Costco and Woolworths. He remained in the vehicle with one staff member while the second staff member completed shopping. During this time, Luke was observed humming and vocalising loudly. No distress was noted. 5:00 PM: Returned home. Luke declined his usual evening walk. He chose to assist with bringing groceries into the house and held onto staff for support. Luke communicated he was not in the mood to engage in his routine walk. 5:20 PM: Luke requested access to the television remote, which was provided. He independently browsed and watched YouTube content. Personal Care & Hygiene 6:00 PM: Luke was supported with a warm shower. He remained in the shower for approximately 35 minutes and appeared relaxed and content, humming, splashing, and engaging with the water. Staff assisted with drying following the shower. Luke had a bowel motion and passed urine following community access. No concerns noted. Skin Integrity 6:40 PM: Antiseptic cream was applied to a healing injury to Luke’s genital area, as per care requirements. Area observed to be healing. No signs of infection noted. Meals & Medication 7:00 PM: Dinner was provided as requested: minced beef sauce, French fries, chicken nuggets, biscuits, and Pepsi Max (zero sugar). Luke ate independently while watching YouTube. 8:00 PM: Night medication was administered as prescribed. No issues or adverse reactions observed. **Incidents and Action** Behaviour Luke remained generally calm, settled, and comfortable throughout the shift. He engaged positively with staff and activities. Luke displayed self-stimulatory behaviour on two occasions while watching inappropriate YouTube content. Staff maintained dignity and safety, provided appropriate support, and completed cleaning and disinfection of the area in line with hygiene protocols. **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** Evening Routine & End of Shift 9:35 PM: Wind-down routine commenced. Luke was observed pacing and humming in the lounge room while unclothed. Staff provided prompts and encouragement to prepare for bed; however, Luke declined and continued watching YouTube content. 11:00 PM: End of shift. Luke remained awake, pacing and humming while watching YouTube. All household lights were switched on. Luke appeared settled and safe at time of handover. **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity** Nil

Summary: Sheick Kamara added a Note for Luke Taylor @ 25/12/2025 04:00 pm - 11:00 pm
Detailed report: General Overview Luke was handed over to staff at 4:00 PM and greeted staff warmly. Staff were informed that Luke had a positive day at CAS. Upon entering the house, Luke independently turned off all lights and closed doors, then used the toilet. He requested his remote from staff and settled in the lounge to watch television. Luke’s mother and father visited the house to celebrate Christmas with him. Luke appeared happy and excited while opening his gifts and spent positive time with his parents. Luke’s parents later took him out for a drive and purchased McDonald’s for his dinner. Behaviour Luke vocalised frequently throughout the afternoon, with increased vocalisation during the evening. These included whistling and various sounds. Vocalisations were mostly observed while Luke was pacing in front of the television. No aggressive or unsafe behaviours were noted. Physical Activity & Engagement Luke participated in physical activity with staff, including kicking a ball. He also assisted with household tasks, helping to tidy the house and place rubbish from his gifts into the bin. Personal Care & Hygiene At 7:00 PM, Luke was supported with a shower following dinner. Staff 1 provided direct support while Staff 2 cleaned the bathroom. Skin integrity was checked and found to be intact, with no concerns observed. Meals & Medication Luke had McDonald’s for dinner at his request and burger rings for snacks. At 8:00 PM, Luke was administered his evening medication while seated in the lounge watching television. Bedtime Routine Luke commenced his bedtime routine at 8:30 PM, which included his usual singing and whistling. Luke declined earlier prompts to go to bed but eventually settled and was quiet in bed by 11:00 PM. Incidents and Actions Taken No incidents occurred during the shift. Plans and Handover A final welfare check was completed at 11:00 PM prior to Staff 1 and Staff 2 concluding the shift. Irregularities No irregularities were noted.

Summary: Sheick Kamara added a Note for Luke Taylor @ 26/12/2025 11:00 pm - 09:00 am
Detailed report: lient: Luke Shift: Night Shift Shift Start: 11:00 PM Behaviour At the commencement of shift, Luke was awake in his room, humming and intermittently pacing in and out of his room. He continued this behaviour until approximately 12:00 AM, when he settled and returned to bed. At 2:00 AM, Luke woke to use the toilet and afterward paced around the area before returning to bed. At 5:00 AM, Luke woke again, turned on all lights, and began pacing while making high-pitched vocalisations. Staff provided verbal prompts and redirection, successfully supporting Luke back to bed by 5:40 AM. No incidents were reported during the shift. Sleeping Schedule Settled to sleep at 12:00 AM Woke briefly at 2:00 AM for toileting, then returned to bed Woke again at 5:00 AM, resettled and asleep by 5:40 AM Woke for the day at 7:00 AM Toilet Routine 2:00 AM: Luke used the toilet and passed urine (bladder motion). 7:00 AM: Luke had a large bowel movement during morning personal care. Personal Care / Health At 5:00 AM, Luke was observed picking at an old wound. Staff cleaned the area and applied appropriate dressings. Morning personal care was completed at 7:00 AM without issue. Morning Routine 8:00 AM: Luke received his prescribed medications and had breakfast. 9:00 AM: Luke was handed over to the CAS team for planned community access activities. Staff Actions: Staff monitored Luke quietly during periods of pacing and while in bed to ensure safety. Verbal prompts and reassurance were provided as required. Overall Summary: Luke required intermittent support overnight due to pacing and disrupted sleep but responded well to staff prompts. No incidents occurred during the shift.

Date: Saturday, 27/12/25 Time: 06:00 - 14:00 Staff: Abdul and Arjun General status: Upon arrival, handover received from night staff. It was reported that Sunny had an interrupted (on&off) sleep overnight. At the start of the shift, Sunny was asleep, peg feed running on. He slept up till 8am, had morning feed & medication before being given a bed bath. He was generally good. He was not engaged with the eye gaze App today because he did not actively open his eyes while on the wheelchair. He, however, listened to Quran and music on YouTube with the device. He was transferred to the outside the house to meet and play with shadow (Sunny’s pet dog) for about 20mins. Sunny had nil BO, and Nil incident during the shift. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Assessment / activities - Vitals checked - as charted - Sunny had a bed bath, whole body moisturised and massaged, clothes and pad changed. - Nil BO. Tracheostomy Management x2 no. Trachy suctions done: - 09:45 - small, white, thin - 13:30 - small, white, thin - Inner cannula changed x1 - Cuff’s pressure checked & adjusted x2, from 20 &18 to 28 each time. - In-line suction done - nil output . - Trachy dressing done @10:15 - Split dressing changed @13:15 SPC Management - Urine emptied total - 450 - Total fluid intake - 1,250 Medication Administration: Medication administered as per webster pack. All recommended water flush given. Nebuliser given x2 (@08:00 & @12:20) Fluid & Food Intake - Food intake - Peg feed (215mls) administered x2 @08:05 and 12:20 - Water Bolus (120mls) given @11:30 Personal Cares & Skin Checks - Bed bathed, pad and cloth changed; - Nil BO. - Skin check - Intact, Moisturiser applied. Eye-gaze Engagement Eye-gaze device was not in use because Sunny did not actively open his eyes while on the wheelchair. He however listened to Quran & music on the device. Other Cares: - Oral suction attended whenever needed. - Repositioned to the left side @13:35. - Canisters emptied & cleaned - All required daily house tasks completed, - Handed over to the PM shift staff **Incidents and Action** Nil **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity** 6am - 2:30pm The shift was extended by 30 minutes as staff needed to collect Sunny’s medications.

Summary: Hayley Mons Mackellar added a Note for Ross Daly @ 26/12/2025 10:00 pm - 06:00 am
Detailed report: **General Status:** Upon arrival at 10:00 PM, Ross was asleep in his bedroom. He awoke at approximately 12:00 AM. A pad change was completed (LT7 – bowels opened). Bluey/blanket was removed due to soiling, and the blanket was placed in the wash. A clean blanket was provided; however, no spare Blueys were available, so a new one could not be applied. Ross and I had a good conversation; he spoke about his love of animals, particularly dogs. The television was turned on for him, and he was repositioned comfortably in bed. Food and fluids were offered; however, Ross declined and stated he was okay. While Ross was watching television, I noticed a significant number of ants and cockroaches in the kitchen/lounge area. Upon checking the kitchen, mouldy bananas were found in the fruit bowl. These were disposed of, and the kitchen was cleaned. Staff are reminded to regularly check food items and expiry dates, as spoiled food poses a health and safety risk and contributes to pest infestation. Ross later returned to sleep, waking at 3:00 AM and continued watching tv until 5:30 AM, food and fluids were again offered during this time but he declined. Pad check at 3:30am confirmed he remained clean. Blanket was put in the drier, with previous dryer items folded into the basket. Ross remained asleep for the remainder of the shift, and bins were taken out upon departure. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Behaviour: Ross was asleep upon arrival at 10:00 PM. He awoke at approximately 12:00 AM and had a good conversation, during which he expressed his love of animals, particularly dogs. Ross watched television for most of the night and returned to sleep afterward. Personal Care: Pad change completed at 12:00 AM (LT7 – bowels opened). Bluey/blanket removed due to soiling, blanket placed in the wash. A clean blanket was provided; no spare Blueys were available to apply. Pad check at 3:30am confirmed Ross remained clean. Medications: No medications were administered during this shift. Skin Check: No issues noted. Food Intake: Food and fluids offered throughout the shift Activities: Television was turned on for Ross, and he was repositioned comfortably in bed. Laundry managed, with previous dryer items folded into the basket. During the shift, a kitchen check revealed mouldy bananas, which were disposed of, and the area was cleaned. Noted a significant number of ants and cockroaches in the kitchen/lounge area. Staff are reminded to regularly check food items and expiry dates to prevent pest infestations. Bins were taken out upon departure. **Incidents and Action** **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity**

Brush teeth- BL apply toothpaste, staff prompt apply water to toothbrush, staff visually and verbally prompt areas of mouth to brush, count on fingers, staff sign more as BL only brush 1/2 then attempt finish. Pour self mouthwash, staff count on fingers, verbal count for Brandon to rinse mouth with water. Staff prompt and assist wipe gunk from around mouth. Toothbrush dies half way through use, BL with prompting manually brush and put on charge after use by self. Communication interaction: Emerge from room with confused look on face and cheeky smile when see staff, go to gesture cough on sister, staff redirect to list on iPad, BL grab basketball from lounge room and squint instead. Staff show BL outside to basketball hoop where he takes 2 throws before gesture throw ball at staff, staff hold and explain we don’t just throw things, BL get squinty and raise hand to forehead, staff explain we can use iPad to talk prompt again use of iPad, returns to room gesture kick door staff prompt use talking app again. point ball then calendar to Monday funday, staff explain it will in fact be at park and will be able to play basketball. BL sign finish and point back at door. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** 3x cheerios @ 12:30pm 1x protein juice @ 12:45pm 1x movicol @ 1:30pm 2:45pm 1/2 hawain pizza 2:55pm pear juice 4pm 1x Metamucil **Incidents and Action** **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** **Irregular Shift Notes (If Any - in this format) - Start Time/ End Time / Activity**

Medication • Dinner medication already administered prior to 10:00 pm. • No medications required during night shift. Food Intake • Chips consumed intermittently during the night (x4). Activities • Watching TV on the couch. • Lying on the couch resting. • Returned to bed at 2:57 am. **Incidents and Action** Nil **Plans and Handover for Next Shift** Danny remained asleep at 6:00 am. Joanne remained cooperative with all care tasks throughout the shift. No agitation, distress, or confusion was noted during or after the shift. **Assessments and Activities: •Behaviour •Personal Care •Medications •Skin Checks (if necessary) •Food Intake •Activities** Food & Fluid Intake: • Snack: 1 bourbon biscuit • Lunch: ½ cream cheese toast and cordial • Dinner: Cream cheese toast and cordial Staff offered an alternative dinner option; however, Joanne declined and chose to have a sandwich instead. Medication: Lunch, dinner, and bedtime medications were administered as prescribed and at appropriate intervals. No issues or adverse reactions observed. Personal Care / Tasks: • 12:20 pm: Shower completed with two staff assistance. Personal care provided including oral care, skin care, application of moisturiser to face and body, and change into clean clothes. • Joanne’s sister arrived, provided post-Christmas gifts and shared photographs. • Joanne had 1 bourbon drink • 1:00 pm: Grooming completed in Joanne’s room. Joanne transferred to bed with two staff assistance and made comfortable. • 2:00 pm: Joanne and her sister watching TV together. • 3:00 pm: Pad change, perineal care provided, and repositioned comfortably in bed. Meals & Medication Luke had McDonald’s for dinner at his request and burger rings for snacks. At 8:00 PM, Luke was administered his evening medication while seated in the lounge watching television. Bedtime Routine Luke commenced his bedtime routine at 8:30 PM, which included his usual singing and whistling. Luke declined earlier prompts to go to bed but eventually settled and was quiet in bed by 11:00 PM. Incidents and Actions Taken No incidents occurred during the shift. Plans and Handover A final welfare check was completed at 11:00 PM prior to Staff 1 and Staff 2 concluding the shift.
